modulesynopsis.name: mod_zstd
modulesynopsis.description: Compress content before it is delivered to the client.

summary.p: The mod_deflate module provides the COMPRESS_ZSTD output filter that allows output from your server to be compressed before being sent to the client over the network.

section.title: Supported Encodings
section.p: The Zstandard encoding is the only one supported to ensure complete compatibility with old browser implementations. ⚠️ > 19 fail on Browser (Chrome, Firefox)

section.title: Sample Configurations
section.p: This is a simple configuration that compresses common text-based content types.

example.title: Compress only a few types
example.highlight: AddOutputFilterByType ZSTD_COMPRESStext/html text/plain text/xml text/php text/css text/js text/javascript text/javascript-x application/x-javascript

usage.p: The ZstdCompressionLevel directive specifies the level of compression

directivesynopsis.name: ZstdFilterNoteFilterNote
directivesynopsis.description: Places the compression ratio in a note for logging

usage.p: The ZstdFilterNote directive specifies that a note about compression ratios should be attached to the request. The name of the note is the value specified for the directive. You can use that note for statistical purposes by adding the value to your access log.

example.title: Example
example.highlight:
ZstdFilterNote zstd_ratio
LogFormat '"%r" %{zstd_out}n/%{zstd_in}n (%{zstd_ratio}n)' zstd CustomLog "logs/zstd_log" LogFormat '"%r" %{zstd_out}n/%{zstd_in}n (%{zstd_ratio}n)' zstd

directivesynopsis.name: ZstdAlterETag
directivesynopsis.description: Specifies how to change the ETag header when the response is compressed

usage.p: The ZstdCoZstdAlterETag : AddSuffix, NoChange, Remove, (default: AddSuffix)
